sorular.soru: Is this the safest way to transport this child?

feedback.metin: This child is not safely secured, as the headrest on the child restraint system is too low. The top of the headrest must be level with the top of the child’s head to fully protect against head and neck injuries in the event of a collision. Furthermore, because the headrest is too low, the seat belt is not positioned correctly over the shoulder. This increases the risk that the child will be launched out of the seat in case of a collision.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: You are towing another motor vehicle. The towed motor vehicle is considered to be a trailer according to the law. This road is closed to trailers, as indicated by the C-10 sign. You are not allowed to enter this road.

sorular.soru: What should you do in the event of sudden heavy rain?
cevaplar: Reduce speed and turn off ESP.
Reduce speed and activate cruise control.
Reduce speed and switch off cruise control.
sorular.dogruCevap: Reduce speed and switch off cruise control.

feedback.metin: If it suddenly begins to rain heavily, you must be aware of potential slipperiness. Reducing your speed and turning off cruise control is therefore the best course of action. Cruise control must be switched off before you can intervene should your vehicle begin to slip, wasting valuable time before you can react. ESP helps prevent slipping, so turning this off in heavy rain is not recommended.

sorular.soru: Who is allowed to go first?
cevaplar: The driver of the passenger car.

feedback.metin: The cyclist is turning right and has the short turn, while the driver of the passenger car wants to turn left and has the long turn. Here the following applies: the short bend takes precedence over the long bend.

sorular.soru: Are you entering an erf here?

feedback.metin: Here, you enter a 30 km-zone; this is not the same as an erf. Within an erf, you are allowed to drive 15 km/h only.

sorular.soru: What kind of lighting should be used here?

feedback.metin: Always switch on dipped headlights well before entering a tunnel. Sidelights do not emit enough light, and rear lights are not always on when daytime running lights are.

sorular.soru: Is driving with a trailer with a non-functioning overrun brake allowed?

feedback.metin: A trailer’s brake must be fully functioning at all times. If not, the trailer cannot be used on the road.

sorular.soru: What is the risk when overtaking an agricultural vehicle on a narrow road?
cevaplar: You risk entering the soft verge.
sorular.dogruCevap: You risk entering the soft verge.

feedback.metin: Because the road is very narrow, there is a risk you may enter the soft, unsafe verge while overtaking. This may lead to loss of control of the steering wheel. If you want to overtake, you must be sure that you can do so without causing danger or hindrance. When your position is correct before overtaking, that means having enough distance and driving slightly to the left, your view on oncoming traffic will suffice and your own visibility will be good enough.

sorular.soru: What is allowed at this sign?
cevaplar: Stop to pick up or drop off a passenger.
Stop to throw a letter in the mailbox.
Stop to ask someone for directions.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop to pick up or drop off a passenger.

feedback.metin: The E-7 sign indicates a place for the immediate loading and unloading of goods. You may also stop to pick up or drop off a passenger. Stopping to throw a letter in de mailbox or ask someone for directions, falls under parking. Parking is not allowed at this sign.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to take driving lessons if you have been disqualified from driving?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to take driving lessons if you have been disqualified from driving. This also means you are not allowed to operate any vehicle for which a driving licence is required, even under the supervision of an instructor.

sorular.soru: Is this the correct way to walk around the vehicle to your door?

feedback.metin: If you want to get into the vehicle, it is better and safer to walk around the front of the vehicle. This way, you are able to see any approaching traffic. The road must be clear, as you may not obstruct other traffic when opening your vehicle door.

sorular.soru: Does the information on the vehicle registration certificate always have to match the details of the passenger car?

feedback.metin: All data on the vehicle registration certificate must match the details of the passenger car. For example, if you change the colour of the car by having it repainted, you must apply for a new vehicle registration certificate.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: Above your lane, there is a white arrow on the matrix sign. You are most likely being warned that the lane is closed up ahead. You are allowed to drive here, but you will have to use a different lane shortly.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?
cevaplar: Turn to the left or right.

feedback.metin: The fire engine has to wait for the level crossing. You should never put yourself in danger by crossing the level crossing, driving into the verge, or entering the oncoming lane. Wait until the level crossing’s lights go out and let the fire engine pass as soon as possible.

sorular.soru: Which category of road users does someone handling a horse fall under?

feedback.metin: A person handling a horse or livestock is categorised as a driver.

sorular.soru: What is the name of the distance that has elapsed before you act?

feedback.metin: On average, one second of thinking time has already elapsed before you start acting, such as braking. So in this second you are still driving at the same speed. The distance covered in this thinking time is called the thinking distance.

sorular.soru: Is driving with a partially legible driving licence allowed?
cevaplar: It depends on what information is illegible.
Yes, as long as the licence number is readable.

feedback.metin: Your driving licence must always be fully legible. If this is not the case, you must have the licence replaced.

sorular.soru: How do you react here?
cevaplar: You stop only if the children enter the carriageway.
You slow down and prepare to stop immediately if necessary.
You try to avoid the ball.
sorular.dogruCevap: You slow down and prepare to stop immediately if necessary.

feedback.metin: Children often use the street and the entire area as a play area. They play between parked cars and are focused on their game. When a ball rolls into the road, you can be almost sure that children will follow. They are not paying attention to what is happening on the street, which means they may enter the carriageway unexpectedly.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you find yourself behind this gritter with a snowplough?
cevaplar: Maintain enough following distance and do not pass.
Overtake cautiously if the situation permits.
sorular.dogruCevap: Maintain enough following distance and do not pass.

feedback.metin: Overtaking a snowplough can be dangerous, because there is usually a lot of snow on the part of the road you would use to overtake. It is therefore wiser to stay behind the snowplough and maintain sufficient following distance. This means you can better anticipate the snowplough’s movements, and you will brake less often. It’s also important to note that road salt is bad for your car, as it causes rust.

sorular.soru: In this situation, can you use the hard shoulder to get in front of the lorry?

feedback.metin: Using the hard shoulder when merging is prohibited. The acceleration lanes are long enough to control speed and to be able to merge safely via this lane. Under no circumstances should you use the hard shoulder to pass another vehicle. In this case, merge behind the lorry. If you must brake for this, you were either not paying attention before, or you have misjudged the situation.

sorular.soru: Can you pick up a passenger here?

feedback.metin: Stopping on the hard shoulder or in a lay-by is only allowed in emergencies, for example if inclement weather conditions occur, you witness an accident, you become unwell, or your vehicle experiences a technical malfunction. Picking up hitchhikers, resting, and using a mobile device do not qualify as emergencies and using the hard shoulder or a lay-by in these cases is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: The C-18 sign indicates that this road is closed to vehicles wider than 2.6 metres, including load. The maximum width of a passenger car is 2.55 metres, so you can drive here.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light is on?
cevaplar: Make an appointment at the garage as soon as possible.
Stop immediately and call the breakdown service.
Stop immediately and fasten your seat belt.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop immediately and fasten your seat belt.

feedback.metin: This light means a seat belt is not being used. Stop at the side of the road as soon as possible and fasten the seat belt. Do not do this while driving, as it can be dangerous.

sorular.soru: Who should you give way to here?

feedback.metin: When performing a special manoeuvre, you must give way to all other road users, including pedestrians.

sorular.soru: When is the best time to check the coolant level?
cevaplar: As soon as the engine is warm.

feedback.metin: You must check the oil level, tyre pressure, and coolant level on a regular basis, and you should always check these before driving. If the engine is hot, this means the coolant will be very hot.

sorular.soru: Can you overtake the cyclist here?

feedback.metin: You cannot see around the bend fully, and you therefore may not overtake here. Stay behind the cyclist and only overtake after the bend.

sorular.soru: Which sign indicates a recommended speed?

feedback.metin: The A-4 sign indicates a recommended speed of 50 km/h. You are not required to maintain this speed, but the sign is usually there for a reason. The A-3 sign indicates a speed limit.

sorular.soru: May the tow rope be shorter than 5 metres?

feedback.metin: There is no mandatory minimum distance between vehicles when towing another vehicle. However, the maximum distance is five metres. This means you can tow another vehicle with a shorter distance than 5 metres between your vehicle and the one you are towing. However, it is safer to maintain a distance that is not too much shorter than 5 metres and, if possible, use the hazard lights.

sorular.soru: Does driving with a roof rack increase energy consumption?

feedback.metin: Roof boxes, roof racks, and bicycle carriers increase drag and can increase energy consumption by 15-20%.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park in front of an entrance or exit, even if it is your own entrance or exit.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: A broken yellow line road marking indicates that parking is not allowed. However, loading and unloading goods and picking up and dropping off passengers are not classed as parking, and are thus allowed, as long as the car leaves immediately afterwards.

sorular.soru: Should lighting always be present on a load carrier?

feedback.metin: If the load carrier does not shield the car's lights and those lights therefore remain clearly visible, the load carrier itself does not need to have lighting.

sorular.soru: Can you increase your speed now?

feedback.metin: If you are being overtaken by another vehicle, increasing your speed is not allowed as it puts yourself and other drivers at risk.

sorular.soru: Is a bicycle with electric pedal assistance a motor carriage?

feedback.metin: Motor carriages are any vehicles that run on a motor. They do not use tracks (e.g. a train, metro, or tram). Bicycles with pedal assistance are not motor carriages, but speed pedelecs are. Trolleybuses are also motor carriages.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive without a left wing mirror?

feedback.metin: Cars must be equipped with two wing mirrors (one left and one right) and an rearview mirror. These must be securely attached and the mirror glass must not be broken or damaged.

sorular.soru: Is sounding your horn allowed now?

feedback.metin: Sound and light signals are allowed in case of imminent danger and in order to prevent it. If you suspect another driver has not seen you, sounding your horn to prevent a dangerous situation is allowed.

sorular.soru: Can you park here if your passenger has a disabled parking card?

feedback.metin: If you are transporting a passenger who has a disabled parking card, you may use a disabled parking space. Parking must be directly related to the transport of the disabled person. Parking in a disabled parking space to run your own errands while the disabled passenger remains in the vehicle is forbidden.
